  • Constructor Details

    • IndependentAnimator

      public IndependentAnimator​(TextureAtlas atlas, boolean lit)
      Create the Independent Animator for the given TextureAtlas. Extends the AnimationRenderComponent but doesn't need to be attached to an entity. Instead, makes use of given x and y offsets to position the animation in relation to the camera or the scene. Also sizes according to given scales. When using this, should first create the IndependentAnimator by giving it the atlas file. After that, you need to set both the x and y position and scale. Lastly, set whether it should follow the camera or not.
      Parameters:
      atlas - libGDX-supported texture atlas containing desired animations
      lit - Boolean variable of whether this asset should be lit by the lighting engine (true) or not (false).

  • Method Details

    • setPositions

      public void setPositions​(float x, float y)
      Sets the position of where the associated animation should be played.
      Parameters:
      x - the x coordinate of the animation location
      y - the y coordinate of the animation location

    • getPositions

      public float[] getPositions()
      Gets the position of where the associated animation should be played.
      Returns:
      Array corresponding to the x and y positions

    • getScale

      public float[] getScale()
      Gets the scale of the associated animation.
      Returns:
      Array corresponding to the x and y animation scales

    • setScale

      public void setScale​(float x, float y)
      Sets the scale of the animation
      Parameters:
      x - the x scale of the animation
      y - the y scale of the animation

    • setCamera

      public void setCamera​(boolean to)
      Sets whether or not the animation should be displayed in relation to the camera or the scene. I.e. interface animations are for the camera and follow the player. True means that it follows the camera, false means the scene.
      Parameters:
      to - the boolean value to set the animation camera to follow

    • setZIndex

      public void setZIndex​(float index)
      Used to set the z index of the animation now that it is independent to entity. A higher index corresponds to appearing 'above' or infront other visual elements.
      Parameters:
      index - index

    • draw

      protected void draw​(SpriteBatch batch)
      Uses a very similar draw method to AnimationRender component but the main difference is the removal of entity and the replacement of it's position with the positions given by setPositions.
      Overrides:
      draw in class AnimationRenderComponent
      Parameters:
      batch - the animation sprites to render

    • dispose

      public void dispose()
      Description copied from class: Component
      Called when the component is disposed. Dispose of any internal resources here.

    • getZIndex

      public float getZIndex()
      Description copied from interface: Renderable
      Z index controls rendering order within a layer. Higher Z index is drawn on top.
      Specified by:
      getZIndex in interface Renderable
      Overrides:
      getZIndex in class RenderComponent
      Returns:
      Z index
